start_office: ^"Come to San Francisco" they said. "It's like a Gold Rush for private detectives".
^Ain't nobody like Bugsy Rosenthal to look like a damn fool.
^Next thing I know, my wife leaves me, and I'm nearly all out of legit businesses.
^But everybody has to do something for a living.
^And this mob is paying quite well.
^But they're fucking savages, killing each other and all.
^Can't sleep tonight. Cars, gun shots, everybody in town wants to drive me crazy.
^And now the fuckin' phone is ringing.
^Don't even wants to answer, fuck it.

c-0: ^ This damn phone ain't gonna stop itself.

s0: ^Ain't no time to call somebody, they'll wait tomorrow.
s1: ^Could be a business call... Who am I kidding?

g-0: ^I decide to get up and finally answer it.

c-2: ^ Did you fucking see the hour?

g-1: ^It's <color=yellow>James Lanza</color>. We had a problem with Giovanni.
g-2: ^3AM, but we pay you to come even when you're shitting.
^You understand me Rosenthal? Come here right now.
g-3: ^98 Francisco Street . Hurry up, fucking stinks here.

c-6: ^ boy, it's the middle of the fucking night.

g-4: ^I hung up and got out of bed.
^For fuck's sake, what did they do again?

s0: ^Not even the time for a coffee, I put on my hat and go outside to find a cab.

g-5: ^As I'm slowly starting to lose my temper and head back to the office, a 47' Cadillac slows by.

c-9: ^Ain't the time to joke Mr. Rosenthal.

g-6: ^Mr. Lanza sent me to get you, could you please get in the car?

c-11: ^. Couldn't he warn me that you were going to fetch me?

g-7: ^As soon as I seat, my nocturnal driver starts the engine and takes me to Francisco Street.
^He rides smoothly and hardly ever speaks. Francisco is not so far, but he seems to take quite a lot of detours.

s: ^Can't you go directly to the apartment?

c-0: ^Let's say that he needed the skills that I'm able to provide for his protection.
c-1: ^ Is there any place left in North Beach?
^I'm not here to settle down, Mr. Lanza asked me to come to ensure his protection.

c-2: ^ He's not been linked to Lima, has he?
^Not that I know of, the boss was smart enough to make sure that the organization would not be too much harmed.
^I can't say anything, but I'm sure Mr. Lanza will talk to you about it.

c-14: ^Must make sure that we're not tailed sir

c-0: ^Let's say that we caught a lot of heat from the trial.
c-1: ^ kid, Jimmy should have told you so. I'm a simple detective that helps some friends in need.
^Not you personnally, but we must stay on our guard with the trial.
g-0: ^I don't get it, your boss Lima is judged, couldn't you find a straw man to take his place?
^Let's say that it's exactly where you're intervening.

s: ^Are you throwing me under the bus?
^Lima didn't request my help for the trial

c-2: ^ I'll not go down easily motherfucker.
^Don't be stupid, Mr. Lima cannot be saved.
c-3: ^If all had gone accordingly to the plan, you would not have been involved in this.
^So where do I fit in your plan now?

g-8: ^The ride continued in a complete silence.
^Giovanni is dead. Poor kid. And more Italians flooding North Beach.
^Someting's wrong. And I'm gettin' mixed in all that.
^I let you go by yourself. Mr. Lanza is waiting for you inside.

c-17: ^ Before I leave kid, can I ask you something?
^Am I being set up? Are they trying to fuck me over to save their heads?
^Mr. Rosenthal, you're not important enough to worry yourself.

g-9: ^I cross the threshold of the building and go to the second floor. Apartment 237.
^Jimmy Lanza is waiting for me, near to the door.
^For fuck's sake, ain't all Jew boys supposed to arrive on time?

c-18: ^greaseballs like you waiting for me at a crime scene.
^I'm not here to joke around, not with two bodies waiting two feet away.
c-19: ^, I don't have to come like a dog whenever you fuck things up!
^You think I'm happy with this shit? I could have done without two more bodies.
c-20: ^, we have more important to do. Where is he?
^He? You mean them. We found a girl in the bathroom.

c-21: ^ I thought Giovanni was the only one.

g-11: ^We found a prostitute in the bathroom.

c-22: ^, you people really can't keep it in your pants.
^Show some respect, Rosenthal. We're not gonna always feed you.
c-23: ^ The fuck was so good that they both died?

g-12: ^Someone killed them both, or they killed each other, but I don't think so.
^But you're the expert here! So what you gonna do?

s: ^I have some questions for you Lanza.
^I'll go and check on the bodies

c-2: ^We need to go Rosenthal. I'll take you to your office

c-0: ^He was made capo some months ago. Poor kid...
^The Administration chose him to take the place of Lima during the trial.

s: ^You mean that you decided to throw him under the bus.
^What did he do to deserve it?

c-0: ^No, we'll take care of his family. What he was gonna do for us was essential.
c-1: ^Stop insinuating that we wanted him killed. He was not made for this job.

c-0: ^It is mine, and Abati's too. Even Morello agreed.
^And he's the fucking Consigliere, taking care of our soldiers and shit.
^We agreed to tend for his family, at least his mother.
^She's in Sicily. The boy came here on his own. Fuckin' American dream.
^I can't even say for sure that she's a prostitute.
^Only a... how could you say... an educated guess Rosenthal.
^You knew Tommy a little. Always a gentleman with the ladies.

c-2: ^Can't say for sure, that's your job now. Nobody ever saw Tommy with her.
^But we were not following him day and night.

c-0: ^Don't be stupid. I keep a close watch on everyone.

c-3: ^As you should know now, Lima was sent to jail, with a trial coming.
^Abati took his place, and I second him now.

s: ^Too much complication to take the power.

c-0: ^, Sotto-Capi. Is that your title now?
^That was meant to be temporary. We should have exonerated Lima.
^But you know your little complication with Giovanni.
c-1: ^Again, stop your accusations. We were close to freeing the Boss.
g-0: ^Now Lima is taking full power, and I'll second him the best I can.

c-2: ^The Consigliere? He's advising us. He approved of Giovanni's designation.
^I think he's trying to take some distance with the game.
^What can we say about it? That poor bastard earned to rest now.
^We're putting the Family back on its feet, so we're focusing on greater matters.

check_apartment: ^I enter the apartment, only to find a first body. Poor Tommy.
^Ok, let's focus now and do that methodically, ain't I a damn detective?

b: ^ You finally decide to go and check on Giovanni.
^ You decide to check on Giovanni first.

c-0: ^His skull is completely shattered, which is caused by the obvious bullet hole on his forehead.
^Skull and brain pieces are all over the wall behind.
^You find a poker chip on the ground.
c-1: ^Nothing special here, except some old furnitures.
c-2: ^The entire floor is covered in blood. Hers, obviously.

c-0: ^ You take a look at the dead body.
^She really seems to be a prostitute.
^But not a lot of prostitutes have a deep cut accross their throats.
^She didn't come with a lot of stuff. Except for a small lady bag.
^Inside, there's a key for a hotelroom.

c-3: ^It's tidy, as if it was not often used.
^The bed is made. Giovanni didn't sleep here so much.

c-0: ^ You open the door of this massive closet.
^Only to find out that it is nearly empty.
^Not enough for someone to live here.
^Unless that person is a slog. But Tommy was not.

c-4: ^Nothing more for you in that apartment.

end_apartment: ^Lanza, always keeping an eye on me, brought me back to my office on Broadway Street.
^That day could not have been worse.

prostitute_motel: ^Bugsy arrives at the motel where the girl lived and exits the taxi.
^The motel is quite shifty, the neon sign is flickering.

motel_lobby: ^The only persons that come here exits the place immediately, only passing by.
^One man stays here. He seems to be the manager.
^He asks you  if he can help you.
^Bugsy asks if he can visit the girl's room.

g-0: ^The manager is reluctant, he doesn't want to let you in.

c-1: ^ Bugsy threatens him, saying that he should not interfere with the investigation on her death.
c-2: ^ Bugsy tries to convince him that she's his girlfriend, and that he hasn't had news since some days.

g-1: ^The manager leads Bugsy to the room.

motel_room: ^Bugsy enters the room alone. and searches for clues about her.

c-0: ^There's nothing worth noticing, except for the bedside table and a large closet.
^You find an ashtray with a box of matches on the side.
c-1: ^ You open a drawer of the bedside table.

c-0: ^There is a wad of notes, with like 100 dollars in small bills.

c-1: ^You find two kinds of clothes: normal ones, and some only to be worn by a working girl.
^ You go to the desk to check it.
^You find several letters on the desk: seems to be from her sister.
c-2: ^Nothing interesting in the kitchen, but it is small. You return in the room.
c-3: ^ You ask the manager for informations about the girl.

c-0: ^ You ask him if he know what she did for a living.
c-1: ^ You ask him if he knew her name.
^He says that he only know her name, and he didn't have any reason to complain or to ask her for more.

c-4: ^Nothing more to find here, you exit and take the cab back to your office.
^This girl seems to be your only lead for now.
^But you don't know where she worked, or even her name.

condor_club: ^You arrive in front of the Condor Club and exit the taxi.
^The club has a large colorful neon sign, which matches the signs of the other places of the street.
^The Condor's seems to attract a lot of fancy people, men for the most part.
^They don't seem to be here for the drinks.

condor_entrance: ^Bugsy is in the club. The place is crowded.
^There's hardly any stool left empty at the bar.
^The rest of the room is packed, with music and agitation.

g-0: ^The barman does not seem to be interested in you. He's serving the other customers.

c-1: ^ You put a 10 dollars bill on the bar.
^The barman immediately comes, seizes it, and a glass of whiskey appears. You didn't order anything.
c-2: ^ Boy I need to talk to you.
^He doesn't even raise on eye on you.

condor_madam: ^After a few drinks, the barman finally gets to you.

g-0: ^The barman tells you that he knows who you are.
^So does the woman that seats next to you.

c-1: ^She cuts you: she already knows it.
^You're  a lonely fellow, coming here to enjoy the booze and music, without attracting any problem.
^You say that you're not the one searching for problems here.
c-2: ^She stops you. Never with a client. It's a serious business here.
^You say that it is not so serious, even from whorehouse's standards.

c-3: ^ You ask her if a girl is missing.

g-2: ^She starts to get mad: she doen't run a brothel.
^She threatens to get you out of the club.
^Tell her the name of the girl

c-4: ^ You tell her that you found the body of Margaret O'Bannon.
^She says to you to follow her.
c-5: ^ You try to calm her. You're not here to accuse anybody.
^You just want to know if anything happened.
^She gets angrier. Nothing happened, because there's no girl here.
^You will have to come here again once you have the name of the girl.
c-6: ^ You threathen her to call the police if she does not cooperate.
^She's not impressed. Even a little amused.
^You work for Abati, you couldn't even speak to the police.
^She thinks that you should leave the club immediately.
^You will have to come here again once you have the name of the girl.

condor_madam2: ^You go back to the Condor Club. This time, you're sure. The girl's name is Margaret O'Bannon.
^You're in the club. As soon as you enter, the barman sees you.
^He comes immediately to you, with a baseball bat.

c-0: ^ Before the man hits you, you tell him that you have informations on Margaret O'Bannon.
^You see the madam in the back, entering from an hidden door.
^The barman goes to her, whispers something to her.
^He opens the door and tells you to enter.
^You're know in the main part of the club: an hidden casino/brothel.
^She asks you about Margaret. She hasn't seen her from two days.

condor_fail: ^You go back to the Condor Club.
^But you're not so sure about what you could say without getting shot.
^You decide to go back and work a better approach.
